result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Snyder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Snyder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:15 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - does not qualify for PD representation.  Court questions defendant in regards to payments towards court appointed counsel.  Statement by defendant - has reached an agreement.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the charge, will recommend a fine and costs and DNA sample.  Defendant will accept offer.  Court denies the request for court appointed counsel.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$150 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:23 a.m.
Status hearing on June 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:25 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has been denied for public defender and requests court appointed counsel.  Court informs defendant to check if COC has received it, and if not to fill out another one.  Court questions defendant in regards to payments.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 14, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to stop at DA's office to make appointment.

Court adjourned at 9:29 a.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail, without counsel.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail, without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  DA makes recommendation.  Court questions defendant.  Court determines defendant stands mute and enters NGP on behalf of defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature with conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 24, 2016 at 9:15 am.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
